result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Record Update
Order. Notice of Motion and Motion to Withdraw, Affidavit of Christopher M Lummis.
Behavioral Consultants - Dr. Engen Invoice - approved PB Req# 2174 entered 05-03-22 MP, PO#2201819 rec'd on 05-05-22 MP

Defendant Keary William Kielblock in court.  Attorney Chris M. Lummis in court for Keary William Kielblock.  Attorney Brian J Pfeil in court for State of Wisconsin. 

11:45 AM Court calls case.
Atty Pfeil states appearances.

Matter is set for a status hearing to determine where the case is headed.

Prior to going into the documents, Court wants to put on the record, was the GAL for this Defendant, while in private practice, long time ago. Court would recuse itself if the parties wish.

Atty Lummis addresses the Court, does not object for Court to proceed on this case, waives any apparent conflict but does not see a conflict.

Atty Pfeil addresses the Court, does not see any problem. 

Court has not had any contact with Defendant for more than 16 years. 
Defendant is fine with Court staying on the case.

BY THE COURT:
Court will not recuse itself.

Court has read the report from Dr. Engen, marked confidential.

Atty Lummis addresses the Court, is obtaining his client's medical records and will share with the State.
Atty Pfeil is in agreement.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 20, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on June 20, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Status hearing on April 18, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Cover Sheet for Confidential Records and Mental Health Evaluation filed by Behavioral Consultants, Inc. (sent to Br 3 Judge/JA on 04/06/22 sp)
CR-270 Order for Examination under 971.16 NGI (sent to WFU/BC & WCS along with Criminal Complaint)
Filed by Prosecutor.
Defendant's AMENDED Notice of Plea of Not Guilty and Not Guilty by Reason of Mental Disease or Defect filed by Atty Christopher Lummis (sent to Br 3 Judge/JA on 02/08/22 sp)
filed by Atty Christopher Lummis

02:30 PM Defendant Keary William Kielblock in court with Attorney (Atty) Lummis . Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Brian J Pfeil appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   
Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
NOT GUILTY BY REASON OF MENTAL DISEASE OR DEFECT (NGI) plea(s) entered.

State recommends a $ bond with conditions as stated.
BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.  Status conference scheduled for April 11, 2022 at 10:30 am.
